oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Department of Energy Photograph Collection
First meeting of southeastern universities representatives to form Oak Ridge Institute of Nuclear Studies
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fifteen men are seated around a conference table.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Interiors; Meetings; Oak Ridge Institute of Nuclear Studies

Branscomb, Harvie; Brehm, C. E.; Funkhouser, W. D.; Graham, Frank P.; Herzfeld; Carl F.; Hoxton, L. G.; McDaniel, Paul W.; Morris, J. C.; Neilson, W. M.; Parks, J. H.; Paty, Raymond; Pollard, W. G.; Poor, Russell S.; Rosselot, G. A.; Sarbacker, Robert I.; Slack, Frances G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Date is taken from Oak Ridge Journal article of October 17, 1946. This article does not have a photograph, but it does list the representatives as Frank P. Graham, President, University of North Carolina; C. E. Brehm,President, University of Tennessee; Raymond Paty, President, University of Alabama; Harvie Branscomb, Chancellor, Vanderbilt Univeristy; W. D. Funkhouser, Dean, University of Kentucky; Russell S. Poor, Dean, Alabama Polytechnic Institute; Paul W. McDaniel, Acting Chief of Technical Branch of Research Division, Manhattan District and professors Frances G. Slack, Vanderbilt; W. M. Neilson, Duke; J. C. Morris, Tulane; J. H. Parks, Emory; Robert I. Sarbacker, Georgia Institute of Technology; G. A. Rosselot, Georgia Institute of Technology; Carl F. Herzfeld, Catholic University of America; L. G. Hoxton, University of Virginia; W. G. Pollard, University of Tennessee. William G. Pollard is on the right, with pipe in hand.
3045-5; 1945; First Meeting of Representatives From South Eastern Universities For Forming ORINS
